item.title: Eurostar passengers face severe delays after cable theft
item.description: The rail operator says that repairs are now complete but lines are open, but delays will last until the end of the day.

item.title: Nato agrees to ramp up defence spending and says collective security is 'ironclad'
item.description: The 32 leaders also said they were reaffirming their "ironclad commitment to collective defence".

item.title: Watch: BBC's Lyse Doucet reports from Iran on the ceasefire with Israel
item.description: Lyse Doucet reports from the streets of Tehran, where she says things are staring to return to normal.

item.title: Damaged or destroyed - how much does leaked US report on Iran's nuclear sites tell us?
item.description: Fordo is probably the most spied-on place on the planet - and work to understand what is happening there is set to intensify further.

item.title: Trump pushes back after leaked report suggests Iran strikes had limited impact
item.description: The US president says the strikes led to the "virtual obliteration" of Iran's nuclear capabilities while speaking at a Nato summit.
